bibl.title: Letter from J. F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, August 29, 1946

div1.p: Siler writes that he is delighted Hench will plan to attend the annual meeting of the Walter Reed Memorial Association.

div1.head: Letter from J. F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, August 29, 1946
div1.opener:
THE PRESIDENT
GORGAS MEMORIAL INSTITUTE
OF
TROPICAL AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE
INCORPORATED
1835 EYE STREET, N. W.
WASHINGTON, D. C.
August 29, 1946
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
This will acknowledge receipt of your letter of August 23rd and, needless
to say, we are delighted that it will be possible for you to arrange to attend
the annual meeting of the Walter Reed Memorial Association unless something
unforeseen arises.

All of the members who attend these meetings are located here in Washing-
ton and we would be only too glad to select the date which would best meet your
convenience. Heretofore the meetings have been held around the third week in
November because of the fact that the anniversary of Walter Reed's death falls
at that time.

General Reynolds, who is a member of the Board is in Chicago now and it is
not possible for him to attend unless he happens to be in Washington at the time.
Dr. L. O. Howard is now retired and quite feeble and he therefore attends no
meetings.

The by-laws of the association provide that notices shall be sent out two
weeks in advance of the meeting. It would be possible therefore to advance the
date of the meeting by a week. Any date between November 10th and 23rd will
be quite satisfactory to us, and in view of the fact that it makes no differ-
ence whatsoever to the rest of us just when the meeting is held, we would like
very much to have you select a date.

During your stay here I hope that it will be possible for me to have you
go over all the records of the Walter Reed Memorial Association which I keep
at my home. Doubtless you have seen practically all the material in the files
but you might find something of interest.
With very best wishes and kindest regards, I am

closer.signed:
J. F. Siler
Col., U S.A., Retired
3434 - 34th Place, N.W.
Washington 16, D.C.
